title: `--explain` should disambiguate nonexistent from underdocumented error codes

body:
The `--explain EXXX` functionality (does anyone still uses this now that it's [no longer advertised so hard](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/fad4f32c3#diff-4d5b8cff35812b800ff77376382671a7L781)?) gives the same "no extended information" message for real error codes that don't have a "long" explanation written, and nonexistent codes. These messages should be disambiguated (as "no extended information for E0XXX" _vs_. "E0XXX does not exist" or similar).

```
$ rustc --explain E0489 # "type/lifetime parameter not in scope here"
error: no extended information for E0489

$ rustc --explain E9999nonexisting
error: no extended information for E9999nonexisting
```

-----

I _thought_ this would be straightforward to implement: we [_do_ keep track of codes without explanations](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac/src/libsyntax/diagnostics/plugin.rs#L100) (which get successfully [plumbed through to the error index](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac0c20f7b3/src/tools/error_index_generator/main.rs#L104), although the [CSS hides them](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac0c20f7b3/src/tools/error_index_generator/main.rs#L68-L69)), only to [throw that information away](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac/src/libsyntax/diagnostics/plugin.rs#L198-L199) when macroexpanding the arrays [that ultimately stock the `--explain` functionality](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac0c20/src/librustc_driver/lib.rs#L1329-L1342). So this _should_, you would _think_, just be a matter of editing [`expand_build_diagnostic_array`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac/src/libsyntax/diagnostics/plugin.rs#L159) to give us a `[(&str, Option<&str>)]` of code–maybe-explanation pairs instead of a `[(&str, &str)]` of code–explanation pairs, editing [`errors::Registry`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac0c20f7b3ab85df1e5e2e3217a7a95630/src/librustc_errors/registry.rs) reflect that, and making the [driver](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/f60bc3ac0c20f7b3ab85df1e5e2e3217a7a95630/src/librustc_driver/lib.rs#L489) care.

But when I actually do this (zackmdavis/rust@048dde26e) ... my changes to `expand_build_diagnostic_array` seem to have absolutely no effect (!?!); we still get a `[(&str, &str)]` even though I _thought_ my code pretty clearly said otherwise, on more than one day that I've looked at this. I hereby give up in despair, bafflement, and tears.
